intro: Agonandra macedoi, commonly known as the Macedonian agony, is a small evergreen tree native to the island of Crete. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes plants like the cashew and poison ivy. The tree is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in clusters. Its fruit is a drupe, typically containing a single seed, and it is adapted to the Mediterranean climate with hot, dry summers. The plant is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
